content.text:
The Eliza project has seen significant development with multiple new plugins and features added recently. Several blockchain-related plugins have been introduced, including support for Cronos EVM, Holdstation swap, Router Nitro, 0x plugin for EVM swaps, BNB chain support, and Cosmos IBC swap functionality. Additionally, a plugin for OriginTrail Decentralized Knowledge Graph and an email plugin were added.

Other notable features include the addition of three new languages to TTS (Text-to-Speech), improvements to X Spaces functionality to wait for silence rather than mute, and enhanced integration tests workflow with improved caching.

Several bugfixes were implemented, addressing issues with boolean parsing for OpenAI Community Plugin settings, chat errors in the OpenAI plugin, and typos in various plugins including the Conflux plugin. The development build and tests were also fixed.

Security updates were made by updating the Vite dependency, and documentation was improved with spelling fixes and the addition of weekly progress notes.

categories.title: Recent Twitter Activity from dankvr and shawmakesmagic

content.text: dankvr shared a workflow that extracts daily insights and suggested that the community-summary channel could become an announcements channel that other servers could follow, enabling new coordination strategies like digital newspapers from different towns.

dankvr is working on open source frameworks at @ai16zdao and tools to measure and reward contributions, focusing on how AI can automate various DAO functions. They also expressed interest in discussing AI and crypto topics that can reach Korean audiences.

dankvr highlighted Hyperfy's technical capabilities, describing it as browser-based with web technologies (webgl, threejs), open standard file formats, a powerful physics engine, and semantic understanding of interactive digital objects with collaborative editing features.

shawmakesmagic announced that he and his wife got the flu, forcing them to cancel some events for the week. He apologized to those affected and noted he'll have more time to code, though not quality time.
Both users engaged in various brief conversations with other Twitter users, including comments about vests, simple greetings, and casual remarks about 'milady'.

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text: The elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository is experiencing several technical issues reported by users. These issues can be categorized into installation problems, startup failures, connectivity issues, and feature requests.

Installation issues include problems with installing the '@elizaos/agent' package as reported by user baltermia, and difficulties installing '@discordjs/opus' due to missing binaries and node-gyp compilation failures reported by lucasdutracoelho.

Startup and operational problems include users being unable to switch characters using command line parameters, getting stuck while downloading the fast-bge-small-en-v1.5 model, and errors related to missing index.js files in the client-direct/dist folder.
Connectivity issues have been reported with users unable to connect to GROQ and difficulties accessing agents on local network IPs when running the client with the --host 0.0.0.0 parameter.
Other issues include failing integration tests in CI, errors in the Plugin-EVM swap handler, and a feature request to add support for DeepSeek API.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the ElizaOS Repository

content.text:
The ElizaOS repository has seen several significant pull requests recently, focusing on expanding functionality and integration capabilities:

- PR #2586 introduces a chainbase plugin for Eliza, contributed by lxcong
- PR #2607 and #2614 are related to the SIMSAI official release, with necessary ElizaOS changes implemented by simsaidev
- PR #2605 adds a MongoDB adapter for ElizaAI, developed by macnablocky
- PR #2655 and #2664 focus on agent functionality, with PR #2664 specifically adding ARM64 fastembed support, contributed by digitalsimboja and jmikedupont2 respectively
- PR #2676 introduces intelligent email evaluation and automation capabilities for Eliza, submitted by Cooops
- PR #2662 adds a new OmniFlix plugin for Eliza, developed by BlockEater96

These pull requests demonstrate ongoing development efforts to enhance Eliza's capabilities across various domains including database integration, agent functionality, and third-party service connections.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 21-22, 2025, there were 29 new pull requests with 19 merged, 18 new issues created, and 66 active contributors. The following day (January 22-23, 2025) saw 37 new pull requests with 12 merged, 15 new issues, and 63 active contributors. Overall, this indicates consistent development activity with a slight increase in pull request creation but fewer merges on the second day, along with a small decrease in both new issues and active contributors.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
